comments.body: This test feels light - you should be verifying that things got created, mount got called, things got torn down. etc.
Added volume path creation checking and permissions check. With this fake mounter, there isn't anything to check as far as the actual mount validation just the volume source.
as above - testing the existence/non-existence is good.  Also testing that mount was called is better.
I wonder if we should just make this part of the standard mount.Interface?

No, I filed a separate bug for it.  Not your problem.

On Thu, Mar 19, 2015 at 11:19 AM, Chris Alfonso notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/kubelet/volume/nfs/nfs_test.go

> > -   fake.FakeMounter.MountPoints = append(fake.FakeMounter.MountPoints, mount.MountPoint{Device: server, Path: target, Type: "nfs", Opts: nil, Freq: 0, Pass: 0})
> > -   return fake.FakeMounter.Mount(fmt.Sprintf("%s:%s", server, source), target, "nfs", 0, "")
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +func (fake *fakeNFSMounter) Unmount(target string) error {
> > -   fake.FakeMounter.MountPoints = []mount.MountPoint{}
> > -   return fake.FakeMounter.Unmount(target, 0)
> >   +}

> > -   return list, nil
> >   +}
